117c138996c5dbbe3211dff570f242b8.title: 70ish Life and Business Lessons for Designers

paragraphs.name: b196
paragraphs.text: Write your story — or someone else will. Everyone has a story to share.
Say people, not users — “Users” sounds impersonal and clinical, try saying “People” or “Customers” instead, especially when sharing your design work with stakeholders.
Your Bias is Bullsh!t — design from a place of education and research and recognize you’re own confirmation bias and other cultural biases you bring to a problem.

paragraphs.name: f4ac
paragraphs.text: Quality is your problem — create with exquisite craftsmanship because you care too do so, not because a client or stakeholder demanded the work to meet a certain quality. The aesthetic and perfection of the execution is always on us the creators to maintain and establish.

paragraphs.name: a742
paragraphs.text: Design in black and white and add color later — if the design doesn't work in black and white then adding color won’t help. Get the work right in black and white first.

paragraphs.name: d348
paragraphs.text: Resentment causes burnout — people don’t quit from working too hard, they leave because they resent a bad boss or have some other resentment building up.

paragraphs.name: 8a55
paragraphs.text: Always talk to the person next to you — You never know what sort of interesting connection you can make with another stranger.

paragraphs.name: 09fa
paragraphs.text: Punch above your weight class — try what scares you, write that article or share that video tutorial or take that speaking opportunity. Try the uncomfortable.

paragraphs.name: 6d23
paragraphs.text: Empathy > Apathy — understand the people you are designing for. Really dig in and understand as much about their lives as you can.

paragraphs.name: 7cf8
paragraphs.text: No 1 designs anything — it takes a village to bring any design to life. Get used to selling your work to stakeholders and team members.

paragraphs.name: d600
paragraphs.text: Save time, use patterns — if your building an iOS app use the Apple Interface Guidelines. If you’re creating an Android app then follow Google Material Design. Many patterns already exist for many design solutions, save yourself some time and learn to find and apply these patterns.

paragraphs.name: 8f17
paragraphs.text: Stop saying “Um”, “I think”, “I feel” and “So” — all of these phrases weaken your statement and make you sound less confident. Removing these words from your speech is difficult but very rewarding.

paragraphs.name: caa6
paragraphs.text: Stop using this, it, that in your writing — next time you write, try to remove the words “this”, “it” and “that” your writing will be easier to understand and read.

paragraphs.name: 8f17
paragraphs.text: Stop saying “Um”, “I think”, “I feel” and “So” — all of these phrases weaken your statement and make you sound less confident. Removing these words from your speech is difficult but very rewarding.

paragraphs.name: 3e78
paragraphs.text: One big thing each day — focus on one task per day and get this task done. In fact, our friend Daniel Burka and his brother created an app to help with this called One Big Thing
Design is not Art — design has to solve a problem or communicate an idea. Art has no burden of solving a problem. Be sure your design is solving a problem and isn’t just beautiful art.

paragraphs.text: Good stuff! Little pushback on this: I understand the importance of showing confidence but I THINK we all need to show a little more humility about what we know and what we don’t know. Stating everything as fact is a logical fallacy. One way to solve this is to give reasons for your argument: “Based on [data XYZ] and my experience/intuition, this new…

5c86fc58a4e5.title: When you used the term “longform” in your intro, I read it as “long hand; picturing the coming…

paragraphs.name: cfc4
paragraphs.text: When you used the term “longform” in your intro, I read it as “long hand; picturing the coming content to be written out. I thought, wow, that would be an unexpected expression of design-thinking, something with gravity, sincerity and hard-earned experience behind it.

paragraphs.name: 9d98
paragraphs.text: So true!
